revised_title: Neural Specificity and Retinotopic Order in the Growth of Optic Fibers
tldr: The authors discuss the multiple factors determining retinotopic order in the growth of optic fibers into the optic tectum. They present evidence supporting the conclusion that optic nerve fiber terminal arborizations can be continuously modified and capable of large-scale movement across the optic tectum. The study also examines the contributions of neural specificity and other ordering mechanisms in the coordinated development of the nervous system.
